intro: Flickingeria rhipidoloba, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Flickingeria rhipidoloba is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
